description: Retention of conversion of integral garage to habitable use, including alterations to rear elevation.
decision_conditions: The proposed development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the materials detailed on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

The garage conversion hereby permitted shall be used only for living accommodation as an integral part of the existing dwelling known as 67 Dunster Crescent and shall not be used as a separate unit of residential accommodation at any time. The internal staircase link between the first floor and the ground floor shall be permanently retained and be fully accessible at all times in accordance with the details set out on drawing no. 3170/P/03 Rev P2 hereby approved.
The site is within an area where the Local Planning Authority consider that the sub-division of existing properties should not be permitted in the interests of amenity.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
